statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Kennedy Meeks scored 18 of his 23 points after halftime to help No. 5 North Carolina pull away from rival North Carolina State 67-55 on Saturday.

video.headline: UNC uses strong second half to outlast rival NC State
video.caption: Kennedy Meeks scores a game-high 23 points to help No. 5 North Carolina slip past NC State in the second half 67-55.
video.description: Kennedy Meeks scores a game-high 23 points to help No. 5 North Carolina slip past NC State in the second half 67-55.
video.title: UNC uses strong second half to outlast rival NC State

article.headline: Kennedy Meeks scores 23 to guide Tar Heels past rival NC State

images.name: UNC uses strong second half to outlast rival NC State
images.caption: Kennedy Meeks scores a game-high 23 points to help No. 5 North Carolina slip past NC State in the second half 67-55.

article.linkText: Meeks powers Tar Heels past rival NC State
article.story:
CHAPEL HILL, N.C. -- North Carolina's Kennedy Meeks attacked the rim, scored through contact and kept throwing himself on the floor for loose balls.

"It was just total effort," coach Roy Williams said.

The fifth-ranked Tar Heels needed every bit of it against rival North Carolina State, too.

Meeks, a 6-foot-9 forward, scored 18 of his 23 points after halftime to help UNC beat NC State 67-55 on Saturday, extending the program's best conference start in 15 years.

While UNC's best scorers, and the team as a whole, struggled to find a flow, Meeks provided the push as the Tar Heels (16-2, 5-0 Atlantic Coast Conference) gradually pulled away from a halftime tie.

It was Meeks' second game back after missing seven with a knee injury. He returned last weekend at Syracuse, then returned to the starting lineup Saturday.

"I had the whole week off, I went as hard as I could those last few days of practice," Meeks said. "I really got after it, got back in the lineup. It's all a confidence thing for me, so I got back in the second half and really tried to play as big as I could."

He made 8 of 10 shots after halftime, blocked two shots and repeatedly made plays while diving on the floor.

"I asked him, 'Did you really dive those three times or did somebody trip you?'" Williams joked afterward.

Abdul-Malik Abu had 12 points and 14 rebounds for the Wolfpack, who controlled tempo and attacked the glass early to build momentum and keep UNC off stride.

But with the score tied at halftime, the Tar Heels pushed ahead with a 16-4 second-half run that featured Meeks scoring over long-armed BeeJay Anya inside, the kind of shots Anya erased in last year's 58-46 win here by the Wolfpack.

NC State (10-8, 0-5) has its worst start in ACC play since going 0-8 in 1996-97.

"We're not going to pout and mope," Wolfpack coach Mark Gottfried said. "They're not going to do that, and we're not going to let them. I've said this many times: 'You watch this game today, I think you have a hard time walking away from here saying, 'NC State's a really bad team.' ... But we're a team that has to get over the hump."

TIP-INS

NC State: Maverick Rowan and Cody Martin, who started over twin brother Caleb, both scored 10 points. ... NC State shot 40 percent. ... The Wolfpack had 18 turnovers. ... Anya had three blocks after swatting six here last year.

UNC: Joel Berry II had 14 points, including two 3s during the 16-4 run. ... UNC came in as one of the nation's best-shooting teams at 50 percent but finished Saturday at a season-low 37.9 percent. ... UNC went 5-of-20 from 3-point range. ... The Tar Heels scored 17 points off turnovers.

CONTAINING CAT

Wolfpack point guard Anthony "Cat" Barber, who leads the ACC in scoring at 22.5 points per game, had a rough day with a season-low nine points. He didn't score after halftime, finishing with more turnovers (5) than field goals (4) or free throws (1) in 35 minutes.

UNC'S BALANCE

The Tar Heels' top three scorers -- Brice Johnson, Marcus Paige and Justin Jackson -- combined for 15 points on 6-for-24 shooting. But UNC and USC were the only teams with six scorers currently averaging in double figures through Thursday's games, according to STATS. That balanced showed Saturday.

"The difference between last year's team and this year's team is, we're dynamic and flexible enough offensively to not sink in a game like that when our best players are struggling," Paige said.

UP NEXT

NC State travels to No. 20 Pittsburgh on Wednesday.

UNC hosts Wake Forest on Wednesday.

videos.headline: Meeks: 'We're a great team'
videos.description: North Carolina forward Kennedy Meeks explains what sparked his strong second-half performance in the Tar Heels' win over NC State, and how they were able to slow down Cat Barber.
